snippets.title: Check IP Configuration
snippets.desc: Display all IP configuration ‚Äî IPs, subnet, gateway, DNS servers.

snippets.title: Release & Renew IP (DHCP)
snippets.desc: Drop current DHCP lease and request a fresh one.

snippets.title: Flush DNS Cache
snippets.desc: Clear the local DNS resolver cache.

snippets.title: Register DNS
snippets.desc: Force the client to re-register its DNS records.

snippets.title: Ping a Host
snippets.desc: Test basic connectivity. Use -t for continuous ping.

snippets.title: Trace Route
snippets.desc: Trace the network path to a destination, showing each hop.

snippets.title: DNS Lookup (nslookup)
snippets.desc: Query DNS records. Specify record types with -type flag.
snippets.cmd:
nslookup google.com
nslookup -type=mx google.com
nslookup -type=txt google.com

snippets.title: DNS Lookup (PowerShell)
snippets.desc: PowerShell-native DNS resolution. Great for MX, TXT, SRV records.
snippets.cmd:
Resolve-DnsName google.com
Resolve-DnsName google.com -Type MX
Resolve-DnsName google.com -Type TXT

snippets.title: Test Port Connectivity
snippets.desc: The #1 most recommended command on r/sysadmin. Replaces telnet for port testing.

snippets.title: Ping with Boolean Result
snippets.desc: Returns True/False ‚Äî perfect for IF statements in scripts.

snippets.title: Show Open Ports & Connections
snippets.desc: List active connections with process IDs.
snippets.cmd:
netstat -ano
netstat -ano | findstr :443
netstat -ano | findstr LISTENING

snippets.title: Find Which Process Owns a Port
snippets.desc: Two-step: find the PID on a port, then identify the process.

snippets.title: Network Packet Capture (No Wireshark)
snippets.desc: Built-in packet capture ‚Äî no extra tools needed. Outputs .etl file.
snippets.cmd:
netsh trace start capture=yes
netsh trace stop

snippets.title: Show Saved Wi-Fi Password
snippets.desc: Reveal the stored password for a Wi-Fi profile.
snippets.cmd: netsh wlan show profile name="WiFiName" key=clear

snippets.title: Open a TCP Listener (Test Firewall)
snippets.desc: Start a listener on a port to test inbound traffic ‚Äî no tools needed.

snippets.title: Get IP Configuration (PowerShell)
snippets.desc: Cleaner IP info than ipconfig.

snippets.title: Find All Domain Controllers
snippets.desc: Discover DCs in the domain via DNS SRV records.

snippets.title: Which DC Am I Authenticating To?
snippets.desc: See which domain controller handled your logon.

snippets.title: Current Logged-in User
snippets.desc: Show the current username and domain.

snippets.title: Get AD User Details
snippets.desc: Pull all properties for a user. Bread and butter of AD mgmt.
snippets.cmd:
Get-ADUser -Identity jsmith -Properties *
Get-ADUser jsmith -Properties * | Select Name, EmailAddress, LastLogonDate, LockedOut, Enabled

snippets.title: Unlock AD Account
snippets.desc: Unlock a locked-out user. Find and unlock ALL locked accounts.
snippets.cmd:
Unlock-ADAccount -Identity jsmith

# Find & unlock ALL locked accounts:
Search-ADAccount -LockedOut | Unlock-ADAccount

snippets.title: Enable / Disable AD Account
snippets.desc: Quickly enable or disable a user account.

snippets.title: Reset AD Password
snippets.desc: Force-reset a user's password.

snippets.title: Check If User Is Locked & Why
snippets.desc: See lock status, bad password count, last logon, password expiry.
snippets.cmd: Get-ADUser jsmith -Properties * | Select Name, LockedOut, BadLogonCount, LastBadPasswordAttempt, LastLogonDate, PasswordExpired, PasswordLastSet

snippets.title: Get AD Group Members
snippets.desc: List all members of a security or distribution group.
snippets.cmd: Get-ADGroupMember -Identity "Domain Admins" | Select Name | Sort Name

snippets.title: Get All Groups a User Belongs To
snippets.desc: See every group a user is a member of.
snippets.cmd: Get-ADPrincipalGroupMembership jsmith | Select Name | Sort Name

snippets.title: Search AD Users (Wildcard / LDAP)
snippets.desc: Find users with partial names using LDAP ANR.

snippets.title: Find Accounts Never Logged In
snippets.desc: Audit accounts that have never been used.
snippets.cmd: Get-ADUser -Filter * -Properties LastLogonDate | Where { $_.LastLogonDate -eq $null } | Select Name, SamAccountName, Enabled

snippets.title: Export All AD Computers
snippets.desc: Dump every computer in AD to a CSV.
snippets.cmd: Get-ADComputer -Filter * -Properties * | Select Name, OperatingSystem, LastLogonDate, IPv4Address | Export-Csv C:\ADComputers.csv -NoTypeInformation

snippets.title: Protect AD Objects From Deletion
snippets.desc: Prevent accidental deletion of users and OUs.

snippets.title: Force Azure AD / Entra Sync
snippets.desc: Trigger immediate delta sync instead of waiting 30 min. Run on AAD Connect server.

snippets.title: Fix Broken Domain Trust Relationship
snippets.desc: Repairs trust without disjoin/rejoin. One of the most praised fixes on r/sysadmin.
snippets.cmd:
Test-ComputerSecureChannel -Repair -Credential DOMAIN\admin

# Alternative:
Reset-ComputerMachinePassword -Server DC01 -Credential DOMAIN\admin

snippets.title: Force Group Policy Update
snippets.desc: Immediately apply group policy changes.

snippets.title: View Applied Group Policies
snippets.desc: Generate an HTML report of all GPOs applied.

snippets.title: List / Add Local Users
snippets.desc: Manage local user accounts.
snippets.cmd:
net user
net user /add NewUser P@ssw0rd && net localgroup administrators NewUser /add

snippets.title: Force AD Replication
snippets.desc: Trigger immediate replication across all DCs.

snippets.title: Full System Information
snippets.desc: Detailed config: OS, hardware, hotfixes, boot time, network.

snippets.title: Remote System Info
snippets.desc: Query system info from a remote machine.

snippets.title: Get Computer Name
snippets.desc: Show this machine's hostname.

snippets.title: Get Serial Number / Service Tag
snippets.desc: Essential for warranty lookups. Works for Dell service tags too.
snippets.cmd:
wmic bios get serialnumber

# PowerShell:
(Get-CimInstance Win32_BIOS).SerialNumber

# Remote:
wmic /node:PCNAME bios get serialnumber

snippets.title: Get Computer Model
snippets.desc: Find the make and model of the hardware.
snippets.cmd:
wmic computersystem get model

# PowerShell:
(Get-CimInstance Win32_ComputerSystem).Model

snippets.title: Check System Uptime / Last Boot
snippets.desc: When was this last rebooted? Perfect for catching liars.
snippets.cmd:
net stats workstation | find "Statistics since"
wmic os get lastbootuptime

# PowerShell:
(Get-CimInstance Win32_OperatingSystem).LastBootUpTime

snippets.title: Find Out Why System Rebooted
snippets.desc: Check Event Log for shutdown/reboot reason.

snippets.title: Windows Version & Build
snippets.desc: Check OS version multiple ways.

snippets.title: List Environment Variables
snippets.desc: Show all environment variables.

snippets.title: Check Installed Hotfixes
snippets.desc: List installed Windows updates.
snippets.cmd:
Get-HotFix | Sort InstalledOn -Descending | Select HotFixID, InstalledOn, Description
Get-HotFix -Id KB5034441

snippets.title: Who Is Logged In Remotely?
snippets.desc: Check who is currently logged into a remote machine.
snippets.cmd:
query user /server:PCNAME
wmic /node:PCNAME computersystem get username

snippets.title: Reliability Monitor (Quick View)
snippets.desc: Instantly open Reliability Monitor ‚Äî great overview of recent crashes.

snippets.title: Battery Health Report
snippets.desc: Generate a detailed HTML battery health report for laptops.

snippets.title: System Information GUI
snippets.desc: Open the detailed System Information panel.

snippets.title: List Running Processes
snippets.desc: Show all processes. Pipe to findstr to filter.

snippets.title: Kill a Process
snippets.desc: Force terminate by name or PID. Works remotely.
snippets.cmd:
taskkill /f /im notepad.exe
taskkill /f /pid 1234
taskkill /s PCNAME /im chrome.exe /f

snippets.title: List / Kill Processes (PowerShell)
snippets.desc: View and manage processes the PowerShell way.

snippets.title: Restart a Service
snippets.desc: Stop and start a service.
snippets.cmd:
net stop "Spooler" & net start "Spooler"

# PowerShell:
Restart-Service -Name Spooler -Force

snippets.title: Manage Services Remotely
snippets.desc: Query or restart services on remote machines.
snippets.cmd:
Get-Service -ComputerName SERVER01 -Name Spooler
Get-Service -ComputerName SERVER01 -Name Spooler | Restart-Service

snippets.title: Count Connections Per Process
snippets.desc: Which process has the most connections? Great for troubleshooting.
snippets.cmd: Get-NetTCPConnection | Group-Object -Property State, OwningProcess | Select Count, Name, @{Name='ProcessName';Expression={(Get-Process -PID ($_.Name.Split(',')[-1].Trim(' '))).Name}} | Sort Count -Descending

snippets.title: Check Disk Space
snippets.desc: Show free/used space on all drives.

snippets.title: Search for a File
snippets.desc: Recursively find files by name across a drive.

snippets.title: Copy Files Fast (Robocopy)
snippets.desc: Gold standard for file copying. Handles retries, logging, mirroring.

snippets.title: Check Disk for Errors
snippets.desc: Scan and repair file system errors. Requires admin.

snippets.title: Get File Hash
snippets.desc: Calculate SHA256/MD5 hash. Essential for verifying downloads.
snippets.cmd:
Get-FileHash C:\file.exe -Algorithm SHA256
Get-FileHash C:\file.exe -Algorithm MD5

snippets.title: Export Anything to CSV
snippets.desc: Pipe any output to a spreadsheet-ready CSV.

snippets.title: Unlock SMB-Locked Files
snippets.desc: Force-close files locked by SMB when the client is gone.

snippets.title: Directory Tree View
snippets.desc: Display folder structure as a visual tree.

snippets.title: Open Explorer at Current Dir
snippets.desc: Quick shortcut from terminal.

snippets.title: Check Firewall Status
snippets.desc: See if Windows Firewall is enabled on all profiles.

snippets.title: Enable / Disable Firewall
snippets.desc: Turn firewall on or off. Requires admin.
snippets.cmd:
netsh advfirewall set allprofiles state off
netsh advfirewall set allprofiles state on

snippets.title: Add Firewall Rule (CMD)
snippets.desc: Allow inbound traffic on a port.
snippets.cmd: netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="Allow 8080" dir=in action=allow protocol=TCP localport=8080

snippets.title: Manage Firewall Rules (PowerShell)
snippets.desc: View and create rules with PowerShell.
snippets.cmd:
Get-NetFirewallRule | Where Enabled -eq True | Select Name, Direction, Action
New-NetFirewallRule -DisplayName "Allow 8080" -Direction Inbound -Protocol TCP -LocalPort 8080 -Action Allow

snippets.title: System File Checker (SFC)
snippets.desc: Scan and repair protected system files.

snippets.title: DISM Repair Component Store
snippets.desc: Repair Windows component store. Run before SFC if SFC fails.

snippets.title: Pause / Resume BitLocker
snippets.desc: Suspend BitLocker before maintenance reboots.

snippets.title: Set Execution Policy
snippets.desc: Allow scripts to run. Use -Scope Process for temp bypass.
snippets.cmd:
Set-ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Scope Process
powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File script.ps1

snippets.title: Remote Desktop (RDP)
snippets.desc: Launch RDP from command line.

snippets.title: Remote PowerShell Session
snippets.desc: Open interactive PS session on a remote machine. SSH for Windows.

snippets.title: Run Command on Remote Machine(s)
snippets.desc: Execute remotely without interactive session. Works on multiple machines.

snippets.title: Restart a Remote Machine
snippets.desc: Reboot a machine across the network.

snippets.title: Launch PowerShell as Admin
snippets.desc: Elevate to admin from an existing session.

snippets.title: Query Remote Machine (WMIC)
snippets.desc: Query WMI data remotely without logging in.
snippets.cmd:
wmic /node:PCNAME bios get serialnumber
wmic /node:PCNAME os get lastbootuptime
wmic /node:PCNAME computersystem get username

snippets.title: Get-Help
snippets.desc: #1 tip from every PS thread. Learn this first, figure out everything else.
snippets.cmd:
Get-Help Get-Service
Get-Help Get-Service -Examples
Get-Help Get-Service -Online
Get-Help *network*

snippets.title: Find a Command
snippets.desc: Search for commands by keyword.

snippets.title: Inspect Object Properties
snippets.desc: Pipe anything to Get-Member to see properties and methods.

snippets.title: Out-GridView (Visual Table)
snippets.desc: Pop results into a sortable, filterable GUI window.
snippets.cmd:
Get-Process | Out-GridView
Get-EventLog Application -EntryType Error -Newest 250 | Out-GridView

snippets.title: Pipe Output to Clipboard
snippets.desc: Copy output directly to clipboard.
snippets.cmd:
ipconfig /all | clip

# PowerShell:
Get-Process | Set-Clipboard
Get-Clipboard

snippets.title: View All Properties
snippets.desc: See every property and its value.
snippets.cmd:
Get-Service Spooler | Format-List *
Get-Service Spooler | Select *

snippets.title: -WhatIf (Dry Run)
snippets.desc: Preview what a command WOULD do without executing.

snippets.title: Count & Group Objects
snippets.desc: Aggregate data ‚Äî like a quick SQL GROUP BY.
snippets.cmd: Get-ADComputer -Filter * -Property OperatingSystem | Group-Object OperatingSystem | Sort Count -Descending

snippets.title: Loop Through Items (ForEach)
snippets.desc: Process multiple items. Backbone of scripting.

snippets.title: Convert MAC Address Format
snippets.desc: Swap dashes to colons in a copied MAC address.

snippets.title: Programs & Features
snippets.desc: Add/Remove Programs ‚Äî the fast way.

snippets.title: Network Adapter Settings
snippets.desc: Jump to network adapter config.

snippets.title: System Properties
snippets.desc: Computer name, domain join, env vars.

snippets.title: Services Manager
snippets.desc: Open Services console.

snippets.title: Device Manager
snippets.desc: Troubleshoot hardware and drivers.

snippets.title: Event Viewer
snippets.desc: Open Event Viewer for logs.

snippets.title: Registry Editor
snippets.desc: Open the registry editor.

snippets.title: Group Policy Editor
snippets.desc: Local GPO editor (Pro/Enterprise only).

snippets.title: Certificate Manager
snippets.desc: User certs and machine certs.

snippets.title: Local Security Policy
snippets.desc: Audit policies, user rights, security options.

snippets.title: Devices and Printers
snippets.desc: Quick printer management.

snippets.title: Open Temp Folder
snippets.desc: Navigate to temp directory for cleanup.

snippets.title: Disk Cleanup
snippets.desc: Free up space with the cleanup wizard.

snippets.title: Shutdown Immediately
snippets.desc: Instant shutdown bypassing update delay.

snippets.title: Restart Immediately
snippets.desc: Instant reboot ‚Äî essential via RDP.

snippets.title: Shutdown / Restart Remote PC
snippets.desc: Remote power with custom message.

snippets.title: Cancel Scheduled Shutdown
snippets.desc: Abort a pending shutdown.

snippets.title: Lock the Workstation
snippets.desc: Instantly lock the screen.

snippets.title: Disable Sleep Mode
snippets.desc: Prevent machine from sleeping.

snippets.title: Disable Hibernation (Reclaim Space)
snippets.desc: Deletes hiberfil.sys ‚Äî frees disk space equal to RAM.

snippets.title: Force Time Sync
snippets.desc: Resync clock with domain/NTP server.

snippets.title: List Installed Software (Safe)
snippets.desc: Registry method ‚Äî avoids Win32_Product MSI reconfiguration.
snippets.cmd: Get-ItemProperty HKLM:\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\* | Select DisplayName, DisplayVersion, Publisher, InstallDate | Sort DisplayName | Format-Table -AutoSize

snippets.title: Remove Windows Bloatware
snippets.desc: List and remove pre-installed Store apps.
snippets.cmd:
Get-AppxPackage -AllUsers | Select Name | Sort Name
Get-AppxPackage *xbox* | Remove-AppxPackage

snippets.title: Manage Printers & Print Queue
snippets.desc: View printers, manage stuck jobs.

snippets.title: BSOD: CRITICAL_PROCESS_DIED (0x000000EF)
snippets.desc: A vital Windows process stopped unexpectedly. Often caused by corrupted system files or bad drivers.
snippets.cmd:
sfc /scannow
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth

:: Boot into Safe Mode if unbootable:
bcdedit /set {default} safeboot minimal

snippets.title: BSOD: MEMORY_MANAGEMENT (0x0000001A)
snippets.desc: Bad RAM, faulty driver, or corrupt system file. Run memory diagnostic.
snippets.cmd:
mdsched.exe
:: Reboots and runs memory test

sfc /scannow
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth

snippets.title: BSOD: IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL (0x0000000A)
snippets.desc: Driver trying to access invalid memory. Usually a driver conflict.
snippets.cmd:
:: Check recently installed drivers:
driverquery /v | sort /r

verifier /standard /all
:: Reboots into Driver Verifier mode

:: Disable after testing:
verifier /reset

snippets.title: BSOD: PAGE_FAULT_IN_NONPAGED_AREA (0x00000050)
snippets.desc: Memory problem ‚Äî faulty RAM or corrupt system file.

snippets.title: BSOD: KMODE_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED (0x0000001E)
snippets.desc: Kernel mode exception from a faulty driver or incompatible hardware.
snippets.cmd:
sfc /scannow
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth

:: Check problem drivers:
driverquery /v /fo list > C:\drivers.txt

snippets.title: BSOD: SYSTEM_SERVICE_EXCEPTION (0x0000003B)
snippets.desc: Driver or system service faulted. Common with GPU drivers.
snippets.cmd:
:: Update GPU drivers first
:: Then:
sfc /scannow
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
chkdsk C: /f /r

snippets.title: BSOD: VIDEO_TDR_FAILURE (0x00000116)
snippets.desc: GPU driver crashed and failed to recover. Reinstall display driver.
snippets.cmd:
:: Uninstall current GPU driver, reinstall latest
pnputil /enum-drivers

:: Force generic driver:
pnputil /delete-driver oem##.inf /uninstall

snippets.title: BSOD: INACCESSIBLE_BOOT_DEVICE (0x0000007B)
snippets.desc: Windows can't access the boot drive. Common after cloning or BIOS changes.
snippets.cmd:
:: From Recovery Command Prompt:
bootrec /fixmbr
bootrec /fixboot
bootrec /rebuildbcd
chkdsk C: /f /r

snippets.title: BSOD: WHEA_UNCORRECTABLE_ERROR (0x00000124)
snippets.desc: Hardware error ‚Äî usually CPU, RAM, or SSD. Check temps and run diagnostics.
snippets.cmd:
mdsched.exe
chkdsk C: /f /r
:: Check CPU temps in BIOS
:: Run manufacturer hardware diagnostics

snippets.title: BSOD: NTFS_FILE_SYSTEM (0x00000024)
snippets.desc: File system corruption or disk failure.

snippets.title: Error: Trust Relationship Failed
snippets.desc: "The trust relationship between this workstation and the primary domain failed."
snippets.cmd:
:: Log in with local admin, then:
Test-ComputerSecureChannel -Repair -Credential DOMAIN\admin

:: Alternative:
Reset-ComputerMachinePassword -Server DC01 -Credential DOMAIN\admin

snippets.title: Error: RPC Server Is Unavailable (0x800706BA)
snippets.desc: Firewall blocking, service not running, or DNS issue.
snippets.cmd:
:: Check if target is reachable:
ping TARGETPC
nslookup TARGETPC

:: Check RPC service:
sc \\TARGETPC query RpcSs

:: Check firewall:
netsh advfirewall firewall show rule name=all | findstr "Remote"

snippets.title: Error: DNS Name Does Not Exist (0x0000232B)
snippets.desc: DNS resolution failure. Check DNS server, flush cache, check suffix.
snippets.cmd:
ipconfig /flushdns
ipconfig /registerdns
nslookup problematic-host.domain.com

:: Check DNS servers:
ipconfig /all | findstr "DNS"

snippets.title: Error: Access Denied (0x80070005)
snippets.desc: Permission issue. Check share and NTFS permissions, UAC, or group membership.
snippets.cmd:
whoami /groups
icacls "C:\path\to\folder"

# Check share permissions:
Get-SmbShareAccess -Name "ShareName"

snippets.title: Windows Update Errors (General Fix)
snippets.desc: Nuclear option for Windows Update failures.
snippets.cmd:
net stop wuauserv
net stop cryptSvc
net stop bits
net stop msiserver
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.old
ren C:\Windows\System32\catroot2 catroot2.old
net start wuauserv
net start cryptSvc
net start bits
net start msiserver

snippets.title: Windows Activation Issues
snippets.desc: Check and troubleshoot activation status.
snippets.cmd:
slmgr /xpr
slmgr /dlv
slmgr /ato

:: If KMS:
slmgr /skms kmsserver.domain.com
slmgr /ato

snippets.title: Outlook Won't Open / Profile Corrupt
snippets.desc: Reset Outlook profile, clear cache, repair.
snippets.cmd:
:: Reset navigation pane:
outlook.exe /resetnavpane

:: Start in safe mode:
outlook.exe /safe

:: Create new profile:
control mlcfg32.cpl

snippets.title: Print Spooler Stuck / Crashed
snippets.desc: Clear jammed print queue and restart spooler.
snippets.cmd:
net stop spooler
del /Q /F /S "%systemroot%\System32\spool\PRINTERS\*.*"
net start spooler

snippets.title: 100% Disk Usage Fix
snippets.desc: Common Windows 10/11 issue. Disable known offenders.
snippets.cmd:
:: Disable Superfetch/SysMain:
sc stop SysMain
sc config SysMain start=disabled

:: Disable Windows Search indexing:
sc stop WSearch
sc config WSearch start=disabled

:: Check disk health:
wmic diskdrive get status
chkdsk C: /f /r

snippets.title: Query Specific Event Log Errors
snippets.desc: Pull recent errors from Event Log for troubleshooting.
snippets.cmd:
Get-EventLog -LogName System -EntryType Error -Newest 20
Get-EventLog -LogName Application -EntryType Error -Newest 20

# Search for specific event ID:
Get-WinEvent -FilterHashtable @{LogName='System'; ID=7031} -MaxEvents 10 | Format-List
